displaytitle: Diptych: Saint George and the Dragon; Virgin and Child, with Saints John and Christopher
dimensions: each panel: 7.7 x 4.8 x 0.6 cm (3 1/16 x 1 7/8 x 1/4 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase, gift of Carl Otto von Kienbusch, Class of 1906, for the Carl Otto von Kienbusch Jr., Memorial Collection

titles.title: Diptych: Saint George and the Dragon; Virgin and Child, with Saints John and Christopher

texts.textentryhtml: John Hunt Collection, Dublin (according to Courtauld Institute Census of Ivory Sculpture); Mathias Komor, New York; purchased in 1956 for Carl Otto von Kienbusch, Jr. Memorial Collection.

This depiction of Saint George and the Dragon is based on a painting by Rogier van der Weyden (1399/1400-64) in the National Gallery of Art, Washington, DC, making this one of the few ivories that can be convincingly identified as Netherlandish.;
